Warm-up

Write a program that prints the number of days, hours, and minutes in a week.

Q2:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
int main() {
    int num = random();
    if (num % 2 == 0) {
        printf("heads\n");
    } else {
        printf("tails\n");
    }
}

Q3:

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    for (int i = 2; i <= 100; i+=2) {
        printf("%d\n", i);
    }
}

~ OR ~

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    for (int i = 0; i <= 100; i++) {
        if (0 == i % 2) {
            printf("%d\n", i);
        }
    }
}

Q4:

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    int i = 2;
    while (i <= 100) {
        printf("%d\n", i);
        i+=2;
    }
}

Q5

int isletter(char ch) {
    if (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') { // Uppercase letter
        return 1;
    } else if (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z') { // Lowercase letter
        return 1;
    } else { // Not a letter
        return 0;
    }
}

Q6:

char flipcase(char ch) {
    if (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') { // Uppercase to lowercase
        return ch - 'A' + 'a';
    } elseif (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z') { // Lowercase to uppercase
        return ch - 'a' + 'A';
    } else { // Not a letter
        return ch;
    }
}

Q7:

#include <stdio.h>
#define MAX 2048
int main() {
    int i = 2;
    while (i <= MAX) {
        printf("%d ", i);
        i *= 2;
    }
    printf("\n");
}

Q8:

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    for (int i = 1; i <= 100; i++) {
        if (i % 3 == 0 && i % 5 == 0) {
            printf("Both\n");
        }
        else if (i % 5 == 0) {
            printf("Five\n");
        }
        else if (i % 3 == 0) {
            printf("Three\n");
        }
        else {
            printf("%d\n", i);
        }
    }
}

Q9:

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
    for (char upper='A'; upper <= 'Z'; upper++) {
        char lower = upper - 'A' + 'a';
        printf("%c%c", upper, lower);
    }
    printf("\n");
}

Q10:

int floorm(int num, int multiple) {
    return num - (num % multiple);
}
